thread.title: Watch: UCC student writes and performs song 'Among The Nine' for shooting victims
thread.title_full: Watch: UCC student writes and performs song 'Among The Nine' for shooting victims | OregonLive.com

author: Jessica Greif | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Watch: UCC student writes and performs song 'Among The Nine' for shooting victims
text:
Caeli Barnhart is one of the students who returned to class Monday morning, more than a week after a gunman killed nine people at Umpqua Community College.
While away from school for 11 days, the third-year accounting student sat down to write a song to tell the story of the day.
Barnhart's description on her YouTube page says she planned to write a song about how afraid she was the day she sat in the corner of her classroom on lockdown and the sadness that's been with her since.
Instead, she says, "I just couldn't get their faces out of my head."
Barnhart decided to write and perform a song for the nine victims focusing on their courage the day they were shot. As of Monday morning, the video had nearly 5,000 views.
Three years ago, Barnhart also wrote a song for the grieving families after the Sandy Hook shooting.
Barnhart has a couple dozen videos of her songs on YouTube, many of them covers of popular artists, but among them, these two pieces of original work.
-- Jessica Greif
jgreif@oregonian.com
@JessicaDGreif
